member.name: P:DevExpress.AgMenu.AgMenu.IsMultiline

summary.para: Gets or sets whether menu items are arranged into several lines when their total width exceeds the menu's width. This is a dependency property.

member.value: true to arranged menu items into multiple lines when the menu's width is too small to accommodate them all; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:DevExpress.AgMenu.AgMenu.Orientation

summary.para: Gets or sets the orientation of the menu. This is a dependency property.

member.value: A value that specifies the orientation of the menu.

summary.para: Identifies the dependency property.
Lists values that specify the type of animation used for submenus.
A menu is faded in.
A menu is shown immediately without any visual effects.

para.para: A menu scrolls, from top to bottom assuming that its parent menu is oriented horizontally. If the screen does not provide enough room, a menu scrolls from bottom to top.
If the parent menu is oriented vertically, a submenu scrolls to the right. If the screen does not provide enough room, a menu scrolls to the left.
A menu slides down, from top to bottom assuming that its parent menu is oriented horizontally. If the screen does not provide enough room, a menu slides up from bottom to top.
If the parent menu is oriented vertically, a submenu slides right. If the screen does not provide enough room, a menu slides left.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the action used to scroll items in a submenu.
An end-user should click a scroll button to scroll menu items.
An end-user should hover the mouse pointer over a scroll button to scroll menu items.
Lists values that specify a menu item's view style.
An item represents a button item in a Menu.
An item represents a subitem in a Menu.
An item represents a button item in a Popup Menu (or submenu).
An item represents a subitem in a Popup Menu (or submenu).
Lists values that specify a menu item's state.
A menu item is disabled and does not respond to end-user actions. To disable a menu item, set its IsEnabled property to false.
A menu item is dropped down, its submenu is shown.
A menu item is highlighted when the mouse enters its boundaries.
A menu item is displayed in its normal state, no end-user action is being performed on it.
A menu item is currently being pressed.
A menu item is currently being selected.
Lists values that specify an item's position among other items in a menu.

A menu item is the first item in a menu. If a menu is oriented horizontally, the menu item is the left most item among other items. If a menu is oriented vertically, the menu item is the top most item.

A menu item is the last item in a menu. If a menu is oriented horizontally, the menu item is the right most item among other items. If a menu is oriented vertically, the menu item is displayed at the bottom.
A menu item isn't the first or the last menu item.
A menu contains only one menu item.
